entries.meaning: An undervaluation; a price or rate below the actual worth.
examples: […]  he must therefore prove that the contract was not at such an undervalue as would amount to fraud  […]

verbs.description: undervalue (third-person singular simple present undervalues, present participle undervaluing, simple past and past participle undervalued)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To underestimate, or assign too low a value to.
(transitive) To have too little regard for.
